title: Potential energy - spring between two blocks

content.question: Two blocks on a horizontal surface are connected by a spring, as shown. A rope pulls one of the blocks with a constant force and both blocks have the same acceleration to the right. Is the spring potential energy zero? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because both blocks are moving with the same acceleration and therefore the spring is unstretched.
Yes, because the spring potential energy has been converted to the kinetic energy of the blocks.
No, because even though the spring is unstretched it is moving and therefore has energy.
No, because the spring must be exerting a force on the left block and therefore must be stretched beyond its equilibrium length.

content.answer: No, because the spring must be exerting a force on the left block and therefore must be stretched beyond its equilibrium length.
